node.title: 'Likelihood of eruption has certainly increased': Mt Ruapehu tremors highest in nine years
node.description: While tremors have increased, the chances of an eruption are still quite low, says a GNS science volcanologist.

node.title: Twitter confirms it's considering adding an edit button
node.description: The announcement came one day after Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who owns a 9.2% share of Twitter, tweeted​ out a poll asking if users wanted an edit button.

node.title: Awarua blaze: Firefighters prepare for challenging conditions as strong winds forecast
node.description: Strong winds are preventing helicopters from fighting a large fire that's burning through internationally significant conservation wetlands south of Invercargill.

node.title: 'It's bigger than both of us': Voters urged to push govt on climate after major report
node.description: A loud message is coming through the new UN climate change report - it is time for us all to radically change our lifestyles. Audio

node.title: The newest meatless meat is made from air
node.description: The meat alternative is created using a fermentation process, similar to making yogurt.

node.title: These lawmakers want more pot to be grown for research
node.description: One House member wants to see more limits on pot use. The other wants to decriminalize it. But they agree that research is hampered by the weed that's available.

node.title: Defense Secretary defends military against Gaetz's accusations of "woke-ism"
node.description: Austin and the congressman from Florida had a heated exchange during a congressional hearing Tuesday on Pentagon priorities.

node.title: Two officers charged in contraband smuggling scheme at Rikers Island
node.description: Four other people, including two inmates at the facility, have also been charged for their alleged roles in the operation.

node.title: Ivanka Trump testifies before US Capitol riot committee
node.description: Former President Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka has testified to the US House of Representatives committee investigating the riot at the Capitol in January last year.

node.title: Auckland DHB workers at critical risk from fatigue - report
node.description: A report to board members said fatigue management had previously been classed as "high" risk but had been temporarily elevated to "critical" to allow for the impact of the Omicron surge.

node.title: Back to font: Parliament as the source of cash and power
node.description: The House - This week's reduction for Road User Charges shows Parliament is always the source of power and of cash. Audio

node.title: Trump-backed Truth Social loses key staffers
node.description: Exit of two key executives highlight the competitive challenges facing the fledgling social media app platform.

node.title: Zelensky tells UN of horrors of Russian invasion
node.description: Ukraine's president says Russia must be held accountable for civilian deaths in northern Ukraine.

node.title: Iwi to take over ownership of land intended for Nelson housing project
node.description: Land earmarked for a housing development near central Nelson will be transferred into iwi ownership.

node.title: Charles Goldie's painting of chief sells for $1.8m at auction
node.description: A painting considered to be one of the finest by revered New Zealand artist Charles Goldie fetched $1.8 million at an art auction in Auckland last night. Audio

node.title: As Covid-19 rules change, workers return to offices
node.description: Workers are returning to offices full of empty desks, blank screens, and quiet staffrooms.

node.title: 1 killed in Texas as damaging storms tear across South
node.description: More than 43,000 homes and businesses from eastern Texas to Georgia were without power Tuesday afternoon.

node.title: JetBlue makes a bid for Spirit Airlines, potentially sparking bidding war
node.description: JetBlue offered about 40% more than what Frontier Airlines was planning to pay for Spirit under a previously announced merger.

node.title: Oklahoma state House approves bill to make almost all abortions illegal
node.description: Under the bill, a person convicted of performing an abortion would face up to 10 years in prison and a $100,000 fine.

node.title: Feds probe vehicle batteries after 5 manufacturer recalls
node.description: After recalls by GM, Mercedes-Benz, Hyundai, Stellantis and Volkswagen, feds are investigating 138,000 batteries made by LG.

node.title: Watch: Party People: Season 2 Episode 11
node.description: In the latest episode, Party People discusses the deaths of Moana Jackson and Dame June Jackson, analyses Christopher Luxon's stance on the Māori Health Authority and says haere rā to Louisa Wall.

node.title: Auckland university experiences record enrolments, multi-million surplus
node.description: The University of Auckland enrolled a record number of students and made a multi-million-dollar surplus last year, despite the pandemic.

node.title: Top U.S. military officer expects Ukraine conflict to be "measured in years"
node.description: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff General Mark Milley told Congress Tuesday that Russia initiated a conflict in Ukraine that will last for quite some time.

node.title: Ukrainian zoo may have to euthanize big animals after shelling
node.description: "Today we are deciding ... whether to put them all down or transport them somewhere else," the zoo's founder said. "Maybe we will save baby jaguars, baby panthers, but all adult animals will probably be liquidated."

node.title: Georgia bill gives state Bureau of Investigations power to investigate allegations of voter fraud
node.description: This is an intimidation tactic," said a Democratic state lawmaker, while Republicans who back it say it will streamline investigations.

node.title: Crews to remove 5,000 containers from cargo ship stuck in Chesapeake Bay
node.description: The Ever Forward cargo ship has been stuck for three weeks.

node.title: Ministry of Health defends legal cost of fight over Māori vaccination data
node.description: Key privacy issues were at stake over a legal battle with Whānau Ora over data on unvaccinated Māori, the ministry says.

node.title: Ukraine president expects more Russian atrocities to be exposed
node.description: The Ukraine president is warning of more civilian deaths as the US and Europe plan new sanctions to punish Moscow.

node.title: US admiral lashes 'concerning' Solomon Islands security pact with China
node.description: A top American admiral has criticised the potential security pact between China and Solomon Islands, describing it as a "secret" arrangement worrying the US and its partners.

node.title: 83-year-old American nun kidnapped in Burkina Faso, diocese says
node.description: Sister Suellen Tennyson had been working in the nation since 2014, her diocese said.
